intro: Corydalis drakeana var. tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to the cold, arid conditions of its native habitat. It is often found growing in rocky soils and alpine meadows, where it thrives in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
